sections.instructions: Answer all questions in this section.

questions.question_text: For each of the items (i) - (x), choose the correct answer from among the given alternatives and write its letter beside the item number.

sub_questions.sub_question_text: The action that man takes against nature aims at

options.A: studying the changes in the process of material production
options.C: showing the relationships between man and man in production
options.D: developing understanding on man and his environment
options.E: changing natural objects into a condition of satisfying human needs.

sub_questions.sub_question_text: Which of the following are included in the archives?

options.A: Division of time into days, weeks and years.
options.B: Family trees, time lines and time charts.
options.C: Colonial records and early travellers' records.
options.D: Cultural items from the earliest times to the present.
options.E: Items which show man's physical development.

sub_questions.sub_question_text: Who among the following was the first systematic tool maker and had a bigger brain than that of Zinjanthropus?
Which of the following best explains the Old Stone Age?

options.D: Man made tools like hand axes.

sub_questions.sub_question_text: Draw a sketch map of Africa and locate the following: (i) the former German colony of Togo (ii) German Cameroon Protectorate (iii) German East Africa (iv) A coast city of Witu (v) South West Africa.
Outline five characteristics of colonial education in Africa.

Arrange the following statements in chronological order by writing number 1 to 5 beside the item number.

(i) The district officers exercised full jurisdiction over the people.

(ii) German rule was renowned for its harshness.

(iii) For the same reasons, very few officers could travel without armed escort for fear of being attacked by the people.

(iv) Force was the base of German rule and each European travelled with a whip.

(v) They meted out to "offenders" any punishments they chose.

The items (i-v) consist of four sentences which form a complete historical meaning. One of the sentences is missing. Identify the missing sentence from the sentences given after each set of items (A - E) and write its letter beside the item number.

1. Commercial contacts between East Africa and the Middle and Far East started around 200 B.C.
2. Early commercial contacts are evidenced by archeological excavations.
3. ____________________
4. The Periplus of the Erythrean Sea written by Greek traders is another evidence.

options.A: These include all the remains observed by the colonial agents.
options.B: These show records of colonial administrators.
options.C: These reveal remains of pottery, porcelain, coins and beads.
options.D: These reveal ancient pyramids along the coast of East Africa.
options.E: These reveal the remains of the greatest slave market in Zanzibar.

sub_questions.sub_question_text:

2. ____________________

sub_questions.sub_question_text:
1. The British based their administration on the indirect rule system.
2. Under this system each ethnic group was subdivided into several administrative units, each under a chief or headman.
3. Local rulers became paid servants of the colonial administration.
4. ____________________

options.A: They were elected in the Anglo-German legislature.
options.B: They acted as the spokesmen of the Europeans in Europe.
options.C: They lost authority they used to have in the pre-colonial period.
options.D: They signed treaties which were beneficial to the Africans.
options.E: They were deposed because of collecting taxes effectively.

sub_questions.sub_question_text:
1. Migrant labour helped the planters to keep the wage of the labourers very low.
2. The labourer left his family at home, so he had no responsibility for feeding his family while at the plantation.
3. His family sustained itself at home.
4. ____________________

options.A: The wage the labourer got was actually meant for his own maintenance.
options.B: The labourer established capitalist companies through this wage.
options.C: The wage the labourer got enabled the family to get their basic needs.
options.D: The labourer used this wage to buy agricultural machines.
options.E: The African kings used the wages of the labourers to pay the soldiers.

sub_questions.sub_question_text:

3. ____________________

options.A: The permanent members include USA, China, Italy, Russia and Britain.
options.B: France, United Kingdom and Italy are some of the permanent members.
options.C: China, Canada, USA and Germany are Examples of permanent members.
options.D: Some of the permanent members are USSR, USA, France and Canada.
options.E: The permanent members include China, France, USSR and USA.
